document_title: Left-sided migraine: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_name: dau-nua-dau-ben-trai.json_3_Who is susceptible to left-sided migraines?
subsection_content:
Anyone can get a left-sided migraine. However, people who are often stressed, under pressure at work or in life, have anxiety disorders, depression, etc. will be more susceptible to headaches.
In addition, people with unscientific living habits, getting little rest, not getting enough sleep, drinking a lot of alcoholic beverages, eating salty foods, often skipping meals, etc. are also at higher risk of migraines.
Women are also more susceptible to migraines or left-sided migraines than men due to hormonal changes during the menstrual cycle, during pregnancy, during premenopause, etc.
See more:
What is frontal migraine? The cause and how to fix it.; What is posterior migraine? Causes, diagnosis and treatment.
Women have a higher risk of left-sided migraines than men
